name: Farm
uniques: Can also be built on tiles adjacent to fresh water

name: Ice-calator
uniques: [+1 Production, +1 Science] for each adjacent [Great Improvement]
Cannot be built on [Fresh water] tiles
Cannot be built on [Strategic resource] tiles

name: Terrace farm
uniques: Cannot be built on [Bonus resource] tiles
Cannot be built on [Strategic resource] tiles

name: Canal Construction Site
uniques: Turn this tile into a [Coast] tile
Turn this tile into a [Canal] tile
Can only be built on [Coastal] tiles
Cannot be built on [Land] tiles <with [3] to [6] neighboring [Canal] tiles>

name: Beacon of Power
uniques: Can only be built to improve a resource
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+12 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: An enclosed area dedicated to researching the ley line phenomenon.

name: Camp
uniques: Can only be built to improve a resource
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+10 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: An unobtrusive camp to gather food resources, lumber, and as a place for hunters to rest.

name: Offshore Platform
uniques: Can only be built to improve a resource
Can only be built on [Water] tiles
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+20 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: The coast/ocean version of the oil well.

name: Oil well
uniques: Can only be built to improve a resource
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+20 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: A deep well that gives access to the crucially-important oil resource.

name: Pasture
uniques: Can only be built to improve a resource
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+10 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: A fenced open land that has been planted with grass to feed grazing animals.

name: Plantation
uniques: Can only be built to improve a resource
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+10 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: An estate on which crops are cultivated for a certain period of time.

name: Rainee's Plantation
uniques: Can only be built to improve a resource
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+10 Gold]
Will not be displayed in Civilopedia

name: Quarry
uniques: Can only be built to improve a resource
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+15 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: A facility that produces any stone or gravel, including marble, a highly-valued stone used for construction and artwork.

name: Taming
uniques: Can only be built to improve a resource
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+15 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: While camp is used to gather food resources, the purpose of taming is to tame animals, especially the rare and strong one.

name: Fishing Boats
uniques: Can only be built to improve a resource
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+10 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: Boats to harvest the valuable resources in the sea.

name: Cultivated farm
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+15 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: A method of farming, which involves the best next generation aspiring farmers with retiring farmers, with special seeds that can be planted even in very cold areas.

name: Fort
uniques: Can be built outside your borders

name: Road
uniques: Can be built outside your borders

civilopediaText.text: Reduces movement cost to ½ if the other tile also has a Road or Railroad
Reduces movement cost to ⅓ with Machinery
Requires Engineering to bridge rivers

name: Railroad
uniques: Can be built outside your borders

civilopediaText.text: Reduces movement cost to ⅒ if the other tile also has a Railroad

name: Remove Forest
uniques: Can be built outside your borders

civilopediaText.text: Provides a one-time Production bonus depending on distance to the closest city once finished

name: Remove Jungle
uniques: Can be built outside your borders

civilopediaText.text: Provides a one-time Production bonus depending on distance to the closest city once finished

name: Remove Fallout
uniques: Can be built outside your borders

name: Remove Marsh
uniques: Can be built outside your borders

name: Remove Road
uniques: Can be built outside your borders

name: Remove Railroad
uniques: Can be built outside your borders

name: Cancel improvement order
uniques: Can be built outside your borders

civilopediaText.text: Repairs a pillaged Improvement or Route

name: Academy
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+15 Science]

civilopediaText.text: A research complexes where children can get an advanced education.

name: Customs house
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+20 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: A governmental building where taxes on imported and exported goods are paid.

name: Holy site
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+20 Faith]

civilopediaText.text: A location held sacred as a testament to the gods, prophets, traditions of a given religion, and as a place of spiritual enlightenment.

name: Landmark
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+10 Culture]

civilopediaText.text: A place of cultural significance, great work of art, or antique structure that draws visitors.

name: Manufactory
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+20 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: A plant consisting of one or more buildings which can make anything you can think of.

name: Citadel
uniques: Adjacent enemy units ending their turn take [30] damage
Can be built just outside your borders
Gain control over [all] tiles in a [1]-tile radius

civilopediaText.text: A mighty fortification that is almost impossible to take by direct attack, and they were capable of standing protracted sieges before they fell.

name: Sea fort
uniques: Adjacent enemy units ending their turn take [10] damage
Cannot be built on [Bonus resource] tiles
Cannot be built on [Luxury resource] tiles

civilopediaText.text: The sea version of citadel.

name: Lodepit
uniques: [+2 Culture] for each adjacent [City center] <after discovering [Acoustics]>
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+8 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: A mining site that is strengthened by a fortress and at the same time as a place for miners to live.
Born as Nkuhanean means born as a miner.
Even the nobles like it, that's why many Lodepits were established around the city.

name: Sacred Grove
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+10 Gold, +5 Culture]

civilopediaText.text: A sacred place constructed by a Maeron.
Home for artists, where a Maeron trains and teaches other Maeron candidates, a place that provides beauty and comfort.
Many great elves have had enlightenment in this place..

name: Ulu Wae
uniques: [+1 Food, +1 Gold] for each adjacent [Water resource]
Cannot be built on [Coast] tiles <with [1] to [6] neighboring [Ulu Wae] tiles>
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+8 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: A tightly-clustered houses on stilts to accommodate people while protecting them from flooding and wildlife in the densely-packed islands
Do note that Ulu Wae can not be built next to each other.

name: Staerie
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+8 Gold, +2 Science]

civilopediaText.text: An encampment with two different functions, that is to observe nature events and to monitor, guard, and anticipate surprise attacks by enemies.
While Staerie is safe from any pillaging during early game, it's better guard this improvement from the invasion of Golems.

name: Dhab Hunter Camp
uniques: Cannot be built on [Desert] tiles <with [1] to [6] neighboring [Dhab Hunter Camp] tiles>
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+8 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: A settlement along the Karionam river, which is used by the Smeheng people to gather food, mainly from desert animals, and collect water.
Dhab Hunter Camp can not be be built next to each other.

name: Vampire Castle
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+15 Gold]
replacementTextForUniques: Provides half of neighboring improvements stats

civilopediaText.text: A cursed castle that can cause one to be dazed and unable to get out.
The strong blood aura on every wall can arouse thirst.
That's right, a person may become a vampire by being bitten by a vampire, having a cat jump over a person's corpse, and by being in this cursed castle 10 nights straight.

name: Coffin
uniques: Can be built outside your borders

civilopediaText.text: A funerary box used for keeping a corpse, either for burial or cremation.
Dracula, unable to stand the sun, uses coffin to rest and recuperate.

name: Blessed Farm
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+8 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: A farm that received a blessing from Inua, the Tundra Goddess, a gift from her to the Louvargians.

name: Matter Transmuter
uniques: Tile provides yield without assigned population
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+12 Gold, +2 Science]

civilopediaText.text: A place where the alchemists of First Order ponder, study, and conduct experiments of changing one matter into another.

name: Meka-Monastery
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+12 Gold, +3 Culture]

civilopediaText.text: The place of worship to the Machine-God and their prophet.
Completing either Piety or Rationalism grants additional bonus for this improvement.

name: Kyber Foundry
uniques: Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+12 Gold, +3 Culture]

civilopediaText.text: A place where the Machinicus forge their machine of war.
Completing either Piety or Rationalism grants additional bonus for this improvement.

name: Oracle Monument
uniques: Cannot be built on [Land] tiles <with [0] to [0] neighboring [City center] tiles>
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+10 Gold]

civilopediaText.text: A tall monument where the oracles, or the Ephor, resides and foretold the future of the Arxian and the probable victory of their army in the future war.
Apart from fortune-telling, the oracles also sell information to the commoners and sometimes sell good luck charms.

name: Sacred Cove
uniques: Cannot be built on [Land] tiles <with [0] to [0] neighboring [Ley Line] tiles>
Cannot be built on [Land] tiles <with [1] to [6] neighboring [Sacred Cove] tiles>
Pillaging this improvement yields approximately [+6 Gold, +2 Culture]

civilopediaText.text: An extension wing of the Beacon of Power, although sometimes this building is not actually connected to the beacon of power.
The Shinso harness the power of the Ley Line in this place.
A bleak reminder of the destruction wreaked by War
Marks the center of a city
Appearance changes with the technological era of the owning civilization

name: Barbarian encampment
uniques: Provides a random bonus when entered

civilopediaText.text: Home to monster and uncivilized barbarians, will spawn a hostile unit from time to time and grants a random bonus when cleared.
